params.text: This is Abi and her doll.
Abi loves her doll.
Abi loves to play with her doll.
Today her doll is lost.
Abi looks in the house.
Is her doll in the kitchen? She looks under the table.
Is her doll in the living room? She looks under the chair.
Is her doll in the bedroom? She looks there for her doll.
Is her doll in the garden? She looks there for her doll.
“Where is my doll?” Abi asks the cat. .
“Meow,” says the cat.
“Where is my doll?” Abi asks the hen.
“Ku-ku-ku,” says the hen.
“Where is my doll?” Abi asks the dog.
“Bow wow wow” says the dog. The dog found the doll.

"The Lost Doll" credits

This work, "The Lost Doll", is a derivative of "The Lost Doll" as translated by Alisha Berger and used under CC BY. The © for this translation lies with Room to Read, 2015. "The Lost Doll" is based on the original story: 'Umdoli Lolahlekile', by Moleboge Shibboleth Poho. © Room to Read, 2015.

This work, "The Lost Doll" is licensed under CC BY 4.0 by Curious Learning.


Book builder - Deborah Oduman
